page.title: 18RELIGION
page.content: In July 1985, a group of children went to interview the Reverend Marshall, Vicar of Hartford Parish Church. He told them that religion in Hartford has changed a lot in the last few years. He now tries to attract his population by means of brightly coloured posters at the gate and he also uses films and videos to help him in his Christian teaching. He has a busy working day, for even the church based part of his day, which is by no means the busiest, in the first six months of this year has seen 50 funerals, 32 weddings and 24 christenings.
